page.title: 03ST.MICHAELS CHURCH BUDBROOKE
page.content: Dates back to Norman or possibly pre- Norman times (Norman arch on north wall).There have been 48 vicars or incumbents since 1273.Each year there are,on average,16 christenings,4 weddings,8 funeral or memorial services (no burials have been allowed in the churchyard since 1982).There are 2 Sunday services weekly at 1O.3O and 18.3O.Approximately 54 adults and 35 to 4O children attend services. Special services which attract more people are held at Christmas,Easter, Whitsuntide,Mothering Sunday and Harvest Festival.Various groups are attached to the church.Sunday school, Ladies group and Junior choir fellowship meet weekly;a teenage group twice a month;Mothers Union monthly. Because of increased activities a schoolroom was erected in 1982.The bells cannot be rung as unsafe.
